Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
AbstractRendererThe AbstractRender class provides the basic information required by any renderer using the engine
ActionMain subclass for all actions used in the EventHandler
AlphaUsed to set the alpha component of a material
AppThis is an abstract class which is instantiated using the App2 and App3 classes
App2App2 is an Appearance Object for 2D games
App3Visual information for 3D objects
ArrayList< T >The ArrayList class works like a Java ArrayList
Bound< V >The Bound class extends the Node class to be able to have a BoundingVolume
BoundingSphere< V >This class implements the BoundingVolume class
BoundingVolume< V >The BoundingVolume class is an abstract class which can be used to wrap any Bound node in a scenegraph
Cam< V >The Cam class is the root subclass for all cameras
Cam2Camera which can be used in 2D i.e it has an x and y position
Cam3A Cam3 is a camera that can be used in 3D space
CameraMan2Allows a camera to be placed in a 2D scenegraph
CameraMan3Allows a Cam3 to be placed directly into a scenegraph
Collider< V, T >A Collider is a leaf Node that is used as a collision area
CollisionDetectorThe CollisionDetector checks the scenegraphs BoundingVolume heirarchy for collisions
CollisionEventSpecific kind of engine Event which deals with object collisions
ColourThis class represents the colour component of a material
DirLightThis class represents a directed Light, which has a direction along a given vector
EventBasic class that all Events should subclass
EventHandlerThe EventHandler handles user input events (i.e touch, button press) as well as events, like collisions, from within the engine
FastMathNumber of trigonometrical operations with reduced accuracy and greater speed than the math.h implementation
Geom< V, T, A >The Geom class extends the Visual class by adding a mesh data
GetNodeInterface for creating all types of Node and BoundingVolume
HashMap< T >Simple HashMap class
HashMap< T >::KeyValuePair< V >This class represents a basic key value pair, based on a string key
LightThis class represents a basic Light object
LightBulbThis class represents a LightBulb
LightManA LightMan is a positional Light that can be placed in a 3D scenegraph
LineAttThis class represents the line attribute of 2D or 3D object
LinkedList< T >LinkedList provides all of the standard operations expected from any linked list
MatThis class represents a Matrix of any size
Mat2Extends the Mat class with a fixed 2x2 dimension
Mat3Extends the Mat clas with a fixed 3x3 dimension
Mat4The Mat3 class extends the Mat clas with a fixed 4x4 dimension
MaterialA Material is a complete material compatible with OpenGL
NodeBase class for all scenegraph nodes
LinkedList< T >::nodeList node, with data and pointer to the next node in the list
ObjectSubclass for all objects which require reference counting
OBJLoader::OBJFaceSmall OBJFace class, created from .OBJ Face data
OBJLoader::OBJGroupWorks on the OBJ grouping principal, with each group representing one section of the model
OBJLexicalAnalyserParses .OBJ and .MTL files into individual Tokens
OBJLoaderThe OBJLoader takes an .OBJ or .MTL file as input, and builds physical geometry from the data
OBJLoader::OBJMaterialA Material class which is in the OBJ MTL format
OBJLoader::OBJStringBasic wrapper to allow STRING LITERALS to be managed by SPtrs
PlaneThis class represents a Euclidean Plane, to be used in 2D or 3D Space
PointAttThis class represents the point attribute of a 2D or 3D object
PolyAttThis class represents the poly attribute of a 2d or 3d object
Queue< T >The Queue class extends the ArrayList class with basic FIFO queue functionality
ResourceManagerHandles all of the resources used throughout the duration of a game
Spatial< V, T >The Spatial class extends the Bound class by adding spatial information
SpotLightThis class represents a SpotLight
SPtr< T >The SPtr class is reference counted smart pointer implementation
Stack< T >The Stack class extends the ArrayList class with typical stack operations
TexCoordThis is a simple wrapper class that allows texture coordinate arrays to be held by SPtrs, and therfore have them delete correctly when used in an ArrayList
TextureThis class holds texture information
TokenUsed by the OBJLexicalAnalyser to store individual tokens found in a .OBJ file
TrfmAbstract class that is implemented by Trfm2 and Trfm3
Trfm2Implements the Trfm class to be used in 2 dimensions
Trfm3Extends the Trfm class to be used in 3D space
TrimeshHolds mesh data for 2D and 3D meshes
VecThis class represents a Vector of any size
Vec2This class represents a Vector of size 2
Vec3This class represents a Vector of size 3
ViewportA Viewport is the view through which a camera sees a scene
Visual< V, T, A >The Visual class extends the Spatial class by adding visual information
